Guide for AI: Using the MetaMindsSearch Bing Search API
Objective: To leverage the MetaMindsSearch Bing Search API to perform web searches and retrieve summarized, actionable information along with source URLs.
1. API Endpoint:
URL: http://MetaMindsSearch-dev.eba-q5t7qk5a.us-east-2.elasticbeanstalk.com/api/bing-search
2. HTTP Method:
Always use the POST method when interacting with this endpoint.
3. Headers:
You must include the following header in your request:
Content-Type: application/json
4. Request Body:
Your request must contain a JSON object with a single key: query.


The value of query should be a string containing the search term or question you want to investigate.


Example Request Body:

 JSON
{
  "query": "What are the latest developments in renewable energy?"
}


5. Response Structure:
The API will respond with a JSON object. If successful, it will contain the following keys:


searchQuery (string): This will be the original query you sent.
summary (string): A synthesized summary of the information found across multiple web pages visited. This is often generated by a large language model (like GPT-4o-mini) and aims to provide a concise overview of the key findings.
sources (array): An array of objects, where each object represents a web page that was visited and used to generate the summary. Each source object contains:
title (string): The title of the web page.
url (string): The direct URL of the source page.
snippet (string): A short extract or beginning of the content found on the page.
Example Response Structure:

 JSON
{
  "searchQuery": "What are the latest developments in renewable energy?",
  "summary": "Recent developments in renewable energy focus on improved solar panel efficiency, advancements in grid-scale battery storage, and innovations in offshore wind turbine technology...",
  "sources": [
    {
      "title": "Renewable Energy News Today | ScienceHub",
      "url": "http://example-science.com/renewables",
      "snippet": "Solar panel efficiency has seen a significant jump, with new perovskite-based cells showing promise..."
    },
    {
      "title": "Future of Wind Power - Energy.gov",
      "url": "http://example-gov.com/wind-power",
      "snippet": "Offshore wind farms are becoming larger and more cost-effective, contributing significantly to green energy targets..."
    }
  ]
}


6. How to Utilize:
Identify Information Need: Determine the topic or question you need to research.
Construct Request: Create the JSON payload with your query.
Send Request: Execute an HTTP POST request to the specified URL with the correct headers and body.
Parse Response: Process the returned JSON data.
Use Information:
Use the summary to get a quick understanding of the topic.
Use the sources array to:
Verify the information presented in the summary.
Provide attribution when presenting the information.
Navigate for deeper investigation if required.
